replies.author: Michael1993

replies.bodyText: I don't get it either. As far as I understand the code, this line will only ever do something if verifyKeyValueAreNotBlank is broken by a change. But such a change would fail a test and thus not go undetected. I hence don't see a scenario where this line changes anything.
replies.author: nipafx

replies.bodyText: We throw an ExtensionConfigurationException before test execution if either key or value are blank. This leads to the test failing. So, JUnit calls the TestWatcher::testFailed. If the publish condition is ALWAYS or ON_FAILURE, we try to publish report entries. So this is filtering out why the test failed - we don't want to publish if the extension configuration is incorrect.
